alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:01AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River at Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River at Scanlon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs of low areas adjacent to the river near Cloquet city park and near Scanlon. At 14.5 feet, Flood waters enter buildings near River Gate Road if unprotected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Sunday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will remain above flood stage through Saturday. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/23/1979. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 13.5 Sun 9 am CDT 13.9 13.5 12.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM CDT.
